description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Annecy" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Annecy

places.generalDescription: Jardins de l'Europe is a picturesque lakeside park in Annecy, offering stunning views of Lake Annecy and the surrounding mountains. This 19th-century English-style garden provides a peaceful retreat for leisurely strolls, picnics, and relaxation. The park boasts century-old plantations, providing a perfect balance of light and shade that appeals to nature lovers and artists alike.

sources.snippet: As well as its great proximity to plenty of nature, Annecy also boasts a number of green spaces, and one of the most popular spots in the city is Jardins de l‚ÄôEurope (the Gardens of Europe). This charming space boasts features such as statues, mountain views, and is a great spot for a picnic!
sources.shortName: An Insider's Guide to the 10+ Best Things to do in Annecy

sources.snippet: While you‚Äôre wandering along Lake Annecy, you‚Äôll also want to stop in the Jardins de l‚ÄôEurope for a visit. This is a perfect spot for a picnic amongst the picturesque lake and flower gardens.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best Things to do in Annecy, France: Unmissable Sights That‚Äôll Make You Fall in Love with This Alpine City

sources.snippet: Pont des Amours spans the Vass√© canal and connects the Jardins de l‚ÄôEurope with the Jacquet Promenade, a walkway blessed with yet more sumptuous views of the lake and mountains.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Annecy (France)
8 romantic activities for couples in Annecy

places.name: Jardins de l'Europe

reviews.text: Breathtaking. Perfect for coming either alone, with friends, or in family. Many activities proposed, clean, and overall calm. The lake is a great activity and the water is overall clean. You can get delicious ice cream, swim, do boat peddaling, bike, play soccer, picnic, or just lay on the grass and chill.

We absolutely loved our trip to Annecy! I highly recommend taking a leisurely stroll along the waterfront and exploring this charming park. The views of Lake Annecy and the surrounding mountains are absolutely stunning, and the gardens themselves are beautifully maintained and wonderfully inviting. It's the perfect spot to relax and soak in the natural beauty of this picturesque French town.

This is a lovely park right between the old town and the lake. It is large with a range of options from shady treed areas to open spaces. There is a kids playground that is fenced off. You are right by the lake with plenty of water sport options available. A nice place to eat lunch, exercise or just relax.

places.generalDescription: The Pont des Amours, also known as the Lover's Bridge, is a romantic footbridge in Annecy that has been crossed by countless lovers. It offers stunning views of the city, canal, and Lake Annecy. Whether you approach it from Paquier or Jardins de l'Europe, taking a walk along the water to reach this bridge is a delightful experience.

sources.snippet: Undoubtedly one of the most picturesque spots in Annecy, the Pont des Amours is literally translated into English as ‚ÄòLover‚Äôs Bridge‚Äô. Local legends suggest that if two lovers kiss in the middle of the bridge then they will stay together for life!. Regardless of whether this is true or not, it‚Äôs worth noting the bridge connects the European Gardens to the P√¢quier park.
sources.shortName: An Insider's Guide to the 10+ Best Things to do in Annecy
2 Days in Annecy, France ‚Äì Itinerary & Tips

sources.snippet: Rumor has it, that if you kiss on Pont des Amours or Lover‚Äôs Bridge, you‚Äôll stay together forever. We tried it, of course, and we‚Äôll let you know in a couple dozen years if it worked!. üòâ Even if you don‚Äôt have anyone to kiss, it‚Äôs still worth a visit as the views of the lake and mountains from the bridge are stunning.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to do in Annecy, France

sources.snippet: During your holiday in Haute Savoie, we recommend a visit to the Pont des Amours in Annecy. A must-see for lovers, it is a pedestrian iron footbridge with a breathtaking view over the lake, forming with the Thiou one of the two entrances to the town from Lake Annecy.
sources.shortName: Pont des amours Annecy - All about the Pont des amours in Annecy

sources.snippet: One of the most romantic places to visit is the Pont des Amours. It is a gorgeous bridge that crosses a canal that flows into the Lake‚Ä¶ here is where many couples exchange kisses. It is rumored that if you kiss your partner here, then you‚Äôll be together forever.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog

sources.snippet: Le Pont des Amours: Legend has it that lovers who kiss in the middle of the bridge will be united for eternity. So stop for a while and admire the view of the lake and the mountains on one side and the canal and boats on the other.
sources.shortName: 8 romantic activities for couples in Annecy

sources.snippet: Lovers often take a souvenir photo as they cross the Pont des Amours, with Lake Annecy and the Ile aux Cygnes in the background. The Pont des Amours is a must for lovers visiting Annecy.
sources.shortName: Week-end en Amoureux √† Annecy : S√©jour Romantique au bord du lac

sources.snippet: Pont des Amours spans the Vass√© canal and connects the Jardins de l‚ÄôEurope with the Jacquet Promenade, a walkway blessed with yet more sumptuous views of the lake and mountains.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Annecy (France)

sources.snippet: And for the lovers, one of the best things to do in Annecy is to visit Pont des Amours. Rumor has it that if you kiss your lover here then you‚Äôll be together forever.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best Things to do in Annecy, France: Unmissable Sights That‚Äôll Make You Fall in Love with This Alpine City
Ultimate One Day in Annecy Itinerary (2025)
Things to Do in Annecy

places.name: Pont des Amours

reviews.text: Such a beautiful and romantic spot to stop by when in Annecy!! A must!! The walk in the area is scenic, with towering mountains in the background and the beautiful lake Annecy creating a post card like view üòç you definitely have to come and take in the beauty that Annecy has to offer!

A wonderful spot to admire the lake. The water is so clear and if you go early or is a very peaceful place. It is a very busy spot for locals exercising and tourists. It is very close to the old town so you should have no trouble walking there.
Very beautiful and romantic spot with amazing view to the lake and the surrounding spaces. It is a great place for relaxation from any busy life

places.generalDescription: Le Denti is a popular restaurant known for its innovative and upscale dishes, offering a fine selection of wines in a relaxed and unpretentious setting. Situated near the pristine Lac d'Annecy, one of the largest and cleanest lakes in Europe, it attracts visitors with its limited yet excellent menu focused on fresh seafood. The restaurant's expertise lies in meticulously presenting divinely fresh ingredients in dishes like grilled squid with a delectable chocolate and strawberry dessert, appealing to seafood enthusiasts.

sources.snippet: Le Denti: we weren‚Äôt able to get a reservation, but we really wanted to eat here. Le Denti is a Michelin recommended resutraunt run by a young couple and very well priced for a nice dinner. It‚Äôs just outside the busy part of the city.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to do in Annecy, France

places.name: Le Denti

reviews.text:
Absolutely lovely evening! Beautiful imaginative food full of flavour but delicate too. Merlu with endive and winter vegetables was delicious and dessert with pistachio ice cream was a perfect ending. Amuse bouche with parsley root was fabulous.
Delightful and charming front of house. Despite being very busy she kept an eye on everything and we felt very well looked after.

This was such a cool experience I will remember forever. The atmosphere was very intimate and the staff was extremely kind, passionate, and talented. The food was a total knock your socks off experience. Thank you for serving us, we had an amazing time.

You have to go !! It's more than just foodies an experience of how service and food combined make it perfect .just outside the stone walls of the city, an unassuming little restaurant. You're greeted with a smile, and you hear the kitchen preparing the feast for your eyes and body .6 tables are there its small so book ahead .the owner/ greeter was amazing we speak a bit of French so she explains everything and talks about bio diverse ingredients in food and wine .it's now In my favourite 5 restaurants in my list of ones from around the world. Thank you so much for an amazing meal /experience 10/10

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of the Thiou Canal, Palais de l'√éle is a captivating medieval castle and former prison that has been transformed into an art and history museum. This 12th-century landmark has served various purposes over the centuries, including as a courthouse, mint, and residence for the Dukes of Savoy. Today, it stands as a picturesque symbol of Annecy's rich history and architectural heritage.

sources.snippet: Set in the center of the Thiou Canal, the 12th-century Palais de l‚ÄôIle is arguably the town‚Äôs most photogenic landmark, which, in this scenic place, is saying quite a bit!. Originally built for Lord Annecy, the palace later served stints as a courthouse, mint, and prison, before being converted into today‚Äôs incarnation: a small museum housing art and history exhibits. Also pop into the Ch√¢teau d‚ÄôAnnecy, a large fortress overlooking the town from a hilltop (tip: you‚Äôll save a few dollars by purchasing the palace and castle tickets together).
sources.shortName: Long Weekend in Annecy, France

sources.snippet: If you look up any photo of Annecy, then no doubt you‚Äôll soon come across snaps of Palais de L‚Äô√éle. This mesmerising building looks like it‚Äôs been plucked straight out of a storybook and is actually a former castle and prison that has since been transformed into a history museum. Perched in the very middle of the Thiou Canal and shaped like a ship, this structure dates all the way back to the 12th-century.
sources.shortName: An Insider's Guide to the 10+ Best Things to do in Annecy

sources.snippet: Palais de l‚ÄôIsle is located right in the heart of Annecy‚Äôs old town and is the town‚Äôs most famous and photographed building. It was built back in the 12th century on a triangular island between two forks of the river. Although it looks like a mini castle, it has been used as a courthouse and a prison over the years.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to do in Annecy, France

sources.snippet: Explore the Thiou canal and spot the famous Palais de L‚Äôile monument in the middle of the water. Admire the ducks and swans as they glide gracefully on the crystal clear channel. And, of course, get a few photos or a cup of coffee next to the canals while the world is still waking up.
sources.shortName: Ultimate One Day in Annecy Itinerary (2025)

sources.snippet: Palace was built on a small isle and splits the Le Thiou River into two canals. Palais de l‚ÄôIsle is often described as a building in the shape of the bow of a ship. Its medieval construction and the oldest parts date to the 12th century.
sources.shortName: 20+ Best Things To Do In Annecy, France. Complete Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Built in the middle of the Thiou River, is this iconic structure, built around the 12th century, was once used as a prison. Today, the building is a great postcard image for Annecy!. You can look inside for a small fee (3.80 euros).
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog

sources.snippet: The Thiou canals, **which bring freshness and life to the town. They shape the landscape and give an artistic touch to the romantic old town.
sources.shortName: 8 romantic activities for couples in Annecy
2 Days in Annecy, France ‚Äì Itinerary & Tips
15 Best Things to Do in Annecy (France)

places.name: Palais de I'√éle

reviews.text:
I really enjoyed the visit, and the English pamphlet was helpful. Would be nice if there was an audio-tour option. If you can only visit this or the castle, this was more interesting.
It would be nice to see more artifacts in the place, maybe an old blanket and slop bucket in one of the cells?
You can get a ticket that also includes the castle.
Note they both close between noon and 2 pm.

Early September and got good weather.  A bit chilly in the morning but got better later. Don't expect to see much more than what the pictures show. Very picturesque but keep in mind this was an old jail so keep in mind what you are looking at.

The Palais de l'√éle is a stunning piece of medieval architecture and an iconic landmark nestled in the heart of Annecy's old town. Set dramatically in the middle of the canal, it's incredibly picturesque-perfect for photos, especially from the nearby bridges. Walking by it feels like stepping into a storybook.

The museum inside offers a good glimpse into Annecy's history, including the building's use as a prison and administrative center. The rooms are small but atmospheric, with just enough information to keep it interesting without being overwhelming. Exhibits include historical artifacts and some temporary displays that are a nice surprise.

That said, it's a relatively quick visit-about 30 to 45 minutes tops-so manage expectations if you're looking for a full-scale museum experience. Some areas could use more detailed explanations or interactive features. Still, the value is fair for the entry price, and it's worth a stop, especially if you enjoy architecture or local history.

Tip: try to go early in the day or during off-hours to avoid the crowds, and combine your visit with a stroll around the charming old town.

places.generalDescription: Le Chalet is a charming restaurant located in the heart of Annecy's old town, offering a warm and inviting atmosphere reminiscent of a traditional Savoyard chalet. The timbered surroundings and mountain-themed decor create a cozy ambiance perfect for romantic dinners or lively gatherings with friends. The menu features a mix of traditional Savoyard dishes like fondue, raclette, and tartiflette, as well as seasonal specialties.

sources.shortName: 20+ Best Things To Do In Annecy, France. Complete Travel Guide

places.name: Le Chalet

reviews.text: The food was exceptional and for very reasonable price! We celebrated our anniversary, and it was lovely dinner for the occasion. We enjoyed the fondue and the steak cooked in butter sauce, finished right on the table! Special thanks to Rosie for making our so meal so perfect with her recommendations on wine and food choices.

This place exemplifies the Annecy hospitality. A family run restaurant with the ambiance of the French Alps! Their menu is extensive and the food is delicious,  portions are very generous‚Ä¶ we had to go 3 times during our trip to try all the delicious Savoyard food from this espectacular region! Everything we ate was very tasty and fresh. The service is exceptional and they make you feel right at home.
A very special thanks to Nico, Damien and Rosy for their hospitality and kindness!
We will definitely be back when we visit Annecy!

Beautiful restaurant on a canal with delicious food. Had a great dinner on our last evening in Annecy ‚ù§Ô∏è
Highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: Mobilboard Annecy offers a great tour experience around the city with knowledgeable guides who provide instructions in both English and French. The Segway tour takes you through the bustling streets and into the charming old town, offering a unique way to explore Annecy. Visitors can also enjoy electric bike tours, with comfortable seats and professional staff ensuring an enjoyable biking experience.

sources.snippet: Take a Segway tour to discover the streets and sights of Annecy in a whole new way. Your guide will stop along the way to tell you about the history of this medieval town and to let you enjoy the beautiful scenery.
sources.shortName: 8 romantic activities for couples in Annecy

places.name: Mobilboard Annecy - Location v√©lo & Segway

reviews.text: A great way to easily see a lot in a short time. Very fun. Very safe- even for old ladies

This is my first time in Annecy and my first time riding on a Segaway. My guide Gaspard was extremely professional and patient in his instructions on how to maneuver this mobile apparatus. He spoke good English and was very clear and succinct in his explanation of the city, its historical facts and the beautiful surroundings around the Lake. Highly recommend it !

Fantastic Segway tour with Romane as our guide. Some really interesting facts along the way; who knew the inventor of bleach? Segwayed along the shore and through the park. Great way to spend some time learning to Segway and learning about the fabulous city of Annecy. Definitely recommend that you take the tour. Merci Romane!

places.address: 8 Bis Pl. aux Bois, 74000 Annecy, France

places.generalDescription: Perched on a rocky peak of the Semnoz massif in southeastern France, Basilique de la Visitation is a striking Catholic basilica with commanding views of the city, Lake Annecy, and the surrounding mountains. Built in the early 20th century, this architectural gem offers visitors an opportunity to hike and enjoy panoramic vistas. Its stunning design and rich history make it a must-visit attraction in Annecy.

sources.snippet: Annecy's most photographed monument, the 12th-century Palais de l'√éle stands on an island in the Canal du Thiou. Tourists will find the best views and photo-ops of the Palais de l'√éle on the Pont sur le Thiou (bridge). From this vantage point, the palace appears fortress-like with its sturdy quadrangular construction resembling the bow of a ship.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Annecy

sources.snippet: Tours last 90 minutes and will take you through the Old Town, followed by a trip to the lakeside, Jardins de l‚ÄôEurope and the P√¢quier or perhaps up to the castle and the Basilique de la Visitation.
sources.shortName: 8 romantic activities for couples in Annecy

places.name: Basilique de la Visitation

reviews.text: Very cool modern church with super cool columns :) the staff in the shop next door were very friendly and had cute candles
Very nice church with beautiful modern stained glass windows. The staff was wonderful and they had a nice collection of candles. The view from the hill is very beautiful as well.

This church is absolutely stunning! Are you curious if it's worth a visit? Totally! I mean, what else can you do in Annecy? Plus, the breeze adds an extra thrill! It's a bit of a climb, but think of it as a fantastic workout after savoring a delicious meal downstairs

places.address: 11 Av. de la Visitation, 74000 Annecy, France

places.generalDescription: Les Chineurs de la Cuisine is a charming bistro located in the heart of Annecy's Old Town. The restaurant offers a cozy terrace and serves classic Savoy regional dishes, including the famous potato and cheese tartiflette, as well as quiches and mousses for dessert. Visitors can expect a warm welcome from the friendly staff and enjoy an excellent dining experience with dishes like the perfectly cooked lamb shoulder.

sources.shortName: 2 Days in Annecy, France ‚Äì Itinerary & Tips

places.name: Les Chineurs de la Cuisine

reviews.text: Absolutely lovely menu, we found everything we wanted to try and it was quite difficult to make a choice. Everything looked very testy. French hight quality menu. We ordered a good bottle of wine which pushed the bill up but it paired very well with our meal so no regrets about the total cost. It was a very testy journey. Highly recommend.

They had us at the first bite !!! Absolutely Magnifique!!  Each dish bursting with flavor, perfectly seasoned ingredients of top quality and visually pleasing. Must return to savor other dishes on the menu. Bravo

Best restaurant in Annecy! We loved the food and enjoyed the experience ! Not to mention the lovely waiter who was very friendly and helped is choose the best dishes on the menu! Highly recommend! The food was sensational and the atmosphere is superb

places.generalDescription: Chez Ingalls is a must-visit brasserie in Annecy, offering high-quality French cuisine that skillfully combines traditional and new flavors. The menu features elaborately prepared dishes made by the chef using rigorously selected fresh, local ingredients. The restaurant's idyllic location in the city center, nestled between buildings away from busy streets, provides a tranquil and timeless setting. Guests can enjoy the cozy and romantic terrace during summer evenings.

sources.shortName: 20+ Best Things To Do In Annecy, France. Complete Travel Guide

places.name: Chez Ingalls

reviews.text: Fantastic experience, from the booking to the check out. We chose the menu with 3 dishes and each of them was beautifully served and incredibly tasty. The crew was also very friendly and attentive. The super nice lady who took care of our table gave us some recommendations and was really friendly. The place is well decorated and good atmosphere. We tried to come back in the next day, but we couldn't book in advance, so we couldn't make it again. Therefore, my personal tip is to book in advance üòä

Had a great experience here.  The place has a great vibe whether you sit inside or out and they have a surprisingly large bit of space.  Lots of tables. They had some good signature cocktails (although 2 were unavailable). The heirloom tomato appetizer was delicious and the main dishes were tasty, but what really impressed us was the desserts. Not your typical French selection.  Our favorite was the pistache attack which was a homemade pistachio ice cream bar with raspberry syrup and raspberries on top.  WOW  The apricot rosemary and white peach jasmine sorbets were also fantastic.  I really loved the creativity in these desserts!  We also ordered two other desserts that were also very good. Overall the service was very good, however I am giving only 4 stars for it because it was a little tough to get our server's attention for things like more water, dessert menu, and the receipt to pay (which is actually done at the front we were told). We also never received one of the meals we ordered.  When we realized it had been forgotten my son said it was fine so we didn't say anything but it was on the receipt when we paid so they just took it off.

Loved everything about this quaint French bistro. A delicious menu, fantastic service and in a lovely setting. The wine, bone marrow starter and the veal with polenta was all next level. I will try and go back and try more of this menu before we leave  ü´∂

places.generalDescription: La Cabane is a charming restaurant located in the heart of the old town of Annecy. The cozy ambiance, with log-clad accent walls, sets the stage for a delightful dining experience. The menu offers carefully sourced and seasonal plates, catering to both vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. The restaurant prides itself on using exceptional products from passionate producers who prioritize environmental sustainability.

sources.shortName: 20+ Best Things To Do In Annecy, France. Complete Travel Guide

places.name: La Cabane

reviews.text: Superb! Fresh, tasty, generous portions. We were in a group of non-veg, vegetarian and vegan and there were excellent options for all. Friendly service.

Go upstairs! Great spot away from the chaos of the street when things get really busy (Sunday night in July). While the outdoor seating in the old town is fun, it can sometimes be too much. This quaint upstairs was beautifully decorated and had warm, charming light. Food was good, not great (at least what we ordered), but really enjoyed the location (photos included). Amazing service as well. Everyone on the staff was very attentive and kind.

The quality of the food is great; the portion and the taste is very recommendable. We are very satisfied with what we have paid for.

The hospitality of the staff is very very excellent. The girl staff ( idk her name ) went beyond  , she was able to uncover the needs of the customer. The servers are very polite.

places.generalDescription: L'Esquisse is a stylish restaurant offering a modern take on French Alpine cuisine, complemented by local wines. Founded by Stephane Dattrino, formerly of Le Clos des Sens, the restaurant exudes a relaxed ambiance while delivering attentive service. The menu showcases rich and colorful dishes crafted from high-quality seasonal ingredients like wild garlic and asparagus.

sources.snippet: When it‚Äôs time to whisper sweet nothings to each other over towering zucchini tartare, try the lively L‚ÄôEsquisse, a restaurant that serves gourmet dishes sourced from local fresh-from-the-market produce (reservations are recommended).
sources.shortName: Long Weekend in Annecy, France
2 Days in Annecy, France ‚Äì Itinerary & Tips
8 romantic activities for couples in Annecy

places.name: L'Esquisse

reviews.text: One of the best places in downtown Annecy to enjoy fine dining in a cozy place. The staff is extremely friendly. Food was amazing.

Top notch place. We got to meet the wonderful lady that owns the restaurant with her husband. The food was delicious and expertly prepared. Great wine list too. The chef added surprises which made the experience really fun.

We had a warm and friendly welcome from Magali, who runs L'Esquisse with her husband, St√©phane. She immediately made us feel comfortable and at ease in their cozy restaurant, which only had three tables of two on the ground floor.

The menu is a surprise for everyone, including Magali, who knows the details of the menu a few moments before serving. The menu was comfortable and delicious, based on local and seasonal products and cuisine-while still having some playful elements.

We look forward to returning some day.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the charming town of Annecy, Les Parcellaires is a delightful haven for wine enthusiasts and food lovers alike. This inviting venue boasts an extensive selection of wines and champagnes, ensuring that every palate is catered to. The warm and friendly atmosphere makes you feel right at home from the moment you step inside. Each month, the menu features seasonal sharing plates crafted from fresh regional ingredients, perfectly paired with their impressive wine offerings.

sources.shortName: Welcome - Lake Annecy Tourist Office

places.name: Les Parcellaires

reviews.text:
We had several glasses of wine here‚Ä¶and then I left my glasses behind. They had them for me the next day. We stopped back in for desert‚Ä¶WHEN EVERYWHERE CLOSES THE KITCHEN AT 9PM ON A FRIDAY, THEY ARE OPEN!  Delicious apricot and almond tart!

Service is exceptional & the vibe is very relaxed and unassuming chic at the same time.

It's hard to determine which outshines the other- the service? Or the food and wine? Our experience was exquisite. We tried 3 different French reds which paired beautifully with the freshly prepared delicious small plates. Our server was super knowledgeable and incredibly attentive.  Highly recommend!!
Personal touch with incredible selection of wines and modern small plate dishes. Beautiful elevated environment. Private setting and chic environment. Perfect for a date!

places.address: 4 Rue Vaugelas, Pass. du Pr√© Carr√©, 74000 Annecy, France

places.generalDescription: Le P√¢quier is a picturesque park located along the shores of Lake Annecy, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. It's a perfect spot for picnics, leisurely strolls, and moments of tranquility. Families with young children will appreciate the playground and spacious areas for various activities. The park also provides benches for relaxation and foot-paddle boats for rent to explore the lake.

sources.snippet: Situated between the P√¢quier and the Jardins de l'Europe, the footbridge offers a privileged view of the lake. France and Lake Annecy have nothing to envy Geneva and its Lake Geneva, a natural treasure offering visitors and especially lovers an idyllic setting and magnificent panorama.
sources.shortName: Pont des amours Annecy - All about the Pont des amours in Annecy

sources.snippet: Tours last 90 minutes and will take you through the Old Town, followed by a trip to the lakeside, Jardins de l‚ÄôEurope and the P√¢quier or perhaps up to the castle and the Basilique de la Visitation.
sources.shortName: 8 romantic activities for couples in Annecy

sources.snippet: Le P√¢quier is a seven-hectare esplanade by the Lake for picnicking, connecting the gardens of Europe via the Pont des Amours to the Parc and Palace of the Imperial.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog
2 Days in Annecy, France ‚Äì Itinerary & Tips

places.name: Le P√¢quier

reviews.text: Really beautiful üòç place
It is a nice park if you want to go for a picnic, but too crowded and all the side of the lake is filled with businesses to rent water bycicles or boats to go on the lake, so it is not that peaceful.

By seeing the wide, large, and peaceful green lawn, your mind will be much better.
Sitting by the lake, enjoy the swan teasing you some french fries.

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hill overlooking the old town, Mus√©e-Ch√¢teau d'Annecy is a restored medieval castle that has been transformed into a museum. Constructed over four centuries from the 12th to 16th centuries, it was once the residence of the Counts of Geneva and Dukes of Genevois-Nemours. The castle now houses regional sculptures, paintings, and contemporary art, offering visitors a captivating journey through time.

sources.snippet: Also pop into the Ch√¢teau d‚ÄôAnnecy, a large fortress overlooking the town from a hilltop (tip: you‚Äôll save a few dollars by purchasing the palace and castle tickets together).
sources.shortName: Long Weekend in Annecy, France

sources.snippet: Yet another former Palace turned museum is the Ch√¢teau d‚ÄôAnnecy, which towers above the rest of the town. Constructed between the 12th and 16th-centuries, the resulting complex is a beautiful blend of medieval architecture meets romantic Renaissance elegance. Visit today and you‚Äôll be able to discover more about the history of the town and the lake.
sources.shortName: An Insider's Guide to the 10+ Best Things to do in Annecy

sources.snippet: Visit the Annecy Castle where Counts of Geneva and the Dukes of Genevois-Nemours once resided during the 13th and 14th centuries. The structure today is a result of a combination of medieval defensive architecture and renaissance elegance. After the residence was abandoned in the 17th century, the castle was used as a military barracks until 1947.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog

sources.snippet: The seat of the Counts of Geneva, Ch√¢teau d‚ÄôAnnecy dates to between the 12th and 16th centuries, and there are a few good reasons to climb the steep hill up to this building.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Annecy (France)
2 Days in Annecy, France ‚Äì Itinerary & Tips

places.name: Mus√©e-Ch√¢teau d'Annecy

reviews.text: Especially the museum is worth to visit this castle. You get a huge variety of exciting  views into modern arts, history and also geographical and natural development of the whole region. You should not miss this. The entrance fee is very fair for what they offer!

It is a very impressive building, and the refurbishment of it is very impressive. Lots of history and at the moment has an art exhibition, which will please a lot of people, but I am afraid I am still old school. At 6.50 euros, it is great value. WC's are available in a couple of places, so no need to cross your legs. It's  a shame they don't have rides to the top, from the market, but it was very hot, 31 degrees today. 20.06.25. A great visit, thank you üòä

It is worth the effort to walk up the short but steep hill to the chateau for the views alone but it was also worthwhile going inside. Lots of interesting art, both old and new (ish). It's a pretty cheap place to visit and you can go when it suits, no need to book ahead of time. We spent about an hour there which was more than enough. Takes about 10mins to walk there from the base of the hill on old town.

places.generalDescription: Le Lilas Rose is a delightful family-owned bistro nestled in the heart of Annecy, France. The restaurant offers a warm and inviting atmosphere with its wood-accented interior and terrace. Known for its homemade specialties like lasagna and ratatouille, it's a great spot for families with children. Guests can enjoy regional dishes along with options like onion soup, goat cheese on toast, and raw beef cuts cooked on hot lava stone.

sources.shortName: 20+ Best Things To Do In Annecy, France. Complete Travel Guide

places.name: Le Lilas Rose

reviews.text:
Amazing!
We didn't book a table but arrived at 7 and got an outside seating. The waiter was charming and service was quick. Ordered the charcuterie board for entree and it was great! Mains were Beef Tartare and Pork sausage. Great serving size and delicious.

I definitely recommend dining here!!

The restaurant is in a small street next to the river but absolutely worth it. Great atmosphere and service.
Rustic bistro serving some regional specialties.

Very nice place, I went there on the 26th may 2025.

Some locals day before recommended us this place, because we wanted to eat something traditional.

We ate outside, the wetter was perfect.
Food also. I just didn't like the consistency and the flavour of the onion soup, but the tartiflette was very good as well as the Plat du Jour.

I would come back for sure.

places.generalDescription: L'Etage is a charming restaurant located in the heart of Annecy, offering a wide range of traditional Savoyard dishes and a robust wine selection. Housed in a beautiful 17th-century bourgeois house, this establishment is perfect for family meals, romantic dinners, or even business seminars. The vintage-inspired decor and sophisticated interpretations of traditional recipes create an inviting atmosphere.

sources.snippet: If you are interested in eating locals‚Äô comfort foods, although not healthy, head over to L‚ÄôEtage to sample some of the cheesiest dishes.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog

places.name: L'Etage

reviews.text: A a really good friendly little restaurant along a busy street so it's perfect to watch the world go by. Great atmosphere. The food was lovely and very generous portions. The staff were all excellent. We are English and we did try to communicate in French but when we couldn't manage it the staff all spoke good English and were happy to help us out! Would definitely visit again if in the area.

NOT RECOMMENDED.
We had a very disappointing dinner here. Several staff members came across as quite impolite, particularly a waitress who was serving on the first floor. The glasses were not clean, and when we raised the issue, the waitress claimed it was caused by ‚Äúfriction between the glasses‚Äù and said they ‚Äúwork very hard‚Äù. But one of the glasses we were given had visible smudges, which is unacceptable in any dining environment. During our meal, the same waitress bumped into one of us quite forcefully while walking past and didn't acknowledge it or apologize. That kind of inattentiveness and lack of courtesy left a very poor impression. The service felt disorganized, and the staff didn't seem equipped to manage the number of customers. Lastly, the fondue was overly salty and lacked variety. Considering the price, both the food and the service were disappointing. I wouldn't return or recommend this place based on our visit.

The steak was excellent but the French fries were quite bad; soft and oily. Not great for a French restaurant.
We were also forced to take 4 meals even though we were with a child that was not hungry and wanted to share our food with her.

places.generalDescription: This wine bar has an amazing open kitchen which serves beautiful sharing dishes, making it a perfect place to enjoy a delicious lunch or dinner. The wine menu is impressive, with reasonable prices, and the staff are knowledgeable and able to provide great recommendations. They also have delicious food on offer, including some amazing French cheese dishes.

sources.snippet: Once the sun has set it is time to enjoy a little bit of wine and an appetizer or two. La Cave Wine Bar is the perfect hidden gem to go to for splitting a bottle of amazing French wine and sharing some small plates.
sources.shortName: Ultimate One Day in Annecy Itinerary (2025)

places.name: La Cave

reviews.text: Wow! Great wines, friendly service, attended to my terrible French speaking, and very good food. Treat yourself to a nice big steak! The young ones come to party and drink at night but a table in the cave is worth a meal.

Best Wine bar in town! If you are into wine go here! Huge winelist and top professional guidance. Nice little selection of food that invites to share. Feels very local and not touristed like rest of ‚Äúold city‚Äù in summer. üòú

Excelent wine Bar with very nice selection, modern and with different sitting ambience. Clean and well kept.
Good food. Great wine selection at good prices.
Friendly staff with very good English! Would
Come again for sure !

places.address: passage des √©choppes, 8 Rue du P√¢quier, 74000 Annecy, France

places.generalDescription: Brasserie Saint Maurice is a traditional yet contemporary French restaurant located in the historic center of Annecy. Established in 1967, it offers a blend of classic and modern French cuisine using carefully selected seasonal ingredients. The leafy terrace provides an elegant and warm space for gatherings with friends, colleagues, or family. Situated in the heart of the Old Town, this brasserie is known for its exceptional service and delicious dishes prepared to perfection.

sources.shortName: 20+ Best Things To Do In Annecy, France. Complete Travel Guide

places.name: Brasserie Saint Maurice

reviews.text:
The charcuterie board was so good, 4 varieties of meat and 3 different cheeses, definitely worth the price. The staff was friendly and tried their best to attend to us as soon as they could, since it was a busy night.

There are three seating areas, it was cold when we went so we sat indoors upstairs, which was perfect.

We loved this restaurant, great food, great service and great atmosphere! Will definitely come back !  We had a menu for 35 euros with gravalax, fish of the day and a cheese plate! All was tasting excellent. I would recommend to reserve as restaurant was packed.

Wonderful place. Great service, great food, loved it!  Not on the bust River walk so it's not crazy crowded or impossible to get into. Better prices too.
I'm going back several times while we're here. Loved it.

places.address: 9 Rue du Coll√®ge Chappuisien, 74000 Annecy, France
